FuncDef:
The isis timer lsp-retransmit command configures the LSP retransmission interval over a P2P link.
The undo isis timer lsp-retransmit command restores the default value. The isis timer lsp-retransmit command configures the LSP retransmission interval over a P2P link. The undo isis timer lsp-retransmit command restores the default value. By default, the LSP retransmission interval over a P2P link is 5 seconds.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies an LSP retransmission interval.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 300 seconds. The default value is 5.

ExtraInfo:
On a point-to-point network, devices at both ends of a link synchronize LSDBs with each other by flooding LSPs. The device at one end of the link sends an LSP. If the device at the other end receives this LSP, it replies with a PSNP. If the device that has sent an LSP does not receive a PSNP from the other end in a period of time, the device will retransmit the LSP.
The isis timer lsp-retransmit command is used to set an LSP retransmission interval. Only the devices on a point-to-point network send PSNPs. Therefore, the isis timer lsp-retransmit command will take effect only when it is run on point-to-point interfaces.
